description: A practical, hands-on introduction to building websites. Students will learn the three core languages of the web to create and style their own interactive web pages from scratch.

lessons.title: What is HTML? Your First Web Page
lessons.description: Learn the basics of HTML and create your first web page
lessons.unit: Unit 1: HTML - The Structure of the Web

items: Understand that HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.
Learn that HTML provides the basic structure (the 'skeleton') of a web page.
Create and view a simple 'Hello, World!' HTML file in a web browser.

sections.content:
HTML is not a programming language; it's a 'markup' language. It uses 'tags' to describe different pieces of content. For example, the `

` tag tells the browser that the text inside it is a paragraph. Every HTML file has a basic structure including ``, ``, and `` tags.

Congratulations! You've created your very first web page. You now know that HTML gives a page its structure, like a skeleton gives a body its shape. In the next lesson, we'll learn more tags to add different types of content.

lessons.title: Essential HTML Tags
lessons.description: Master headings, links, and images in HTML
lessons.unit: Unit 1: HTML - The Structure of the Web

items: Learn to use heading tags `<h1>` through `<h6>`.

sections.content: Excellent! You can now add the most common types of content to a web page: headings, links, and images. Your pages are becoming much more interesting. Next, we'll learn how to organize content into lists and sections.
